section.docs: Call Lists represent a list of contacts that need to be called as part of a campaign. The calls are assigned to users and made to contacts. Adding someone to a call list adds them to their todo list. The todo can be reassigned or rescheduled if need be. Call Lists can have their own end date which sets the due date for all the todos. If a end date is not specified, it will be set from the campaign. A contact can be on many different call lists, but cannot be on the same one multiple times. Call lists can also be handled automatically using our VOIP system.

section.title: Routes & Permissions
section.docs:
* `POST /call_lists` * `GET /call_lists` * `GET /call_lists/:id` * `PUT /call_lists/:id' * `DELETE /call_lists/:id`
### Scoping
1. You are managing the associated campaign 2. You are following the associated campaign 3. You are following any of the user's making the calls 4. You are following any of the contacts to be called 5. You are following the user managing the campaign 6. You are an admin

section.title: Creating a Call List
section.docs:
**NOTE**: this functionality is a work in progress. There is some special logic that goes into creating a call list that has not been implemented yet. This specically pertains to addings groups to call lists.
You can add contacts and groups to call lists. You can only add them if they have a phone number. The server will check for duplicates to ensure that the same person is not called twice.
Groups are handled differently than contacts. Groups have primary contacts. If a primary contact is present, they will be added to the call list. If a primaty contact is not present, a new contact will be added with the group's contact phone number. Then, you can fill in that contact's information when you make the call.
